meanings.definition: To enter or record information in an official list or record.
meanings.sent1: She is registering the new students for the school year.
meanings.sent2: I will be registering your name in our system for future reference.
meanings.sent3: The computer kept registering errors, making it impossible to complete the task.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was registering on everyone's faces, spreading joy all around.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell registering the end of the match echoed through the stadium.

meanings.definition: To show or express a particular quality or feeling.
meanings.sent1: His eyes were registering surprise at the unexpected news.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting was registering a sense of tranquility and peace.
meanings.sent3: The dog's tail was registering excitement as it wagged furiously.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were registering the impending thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: Her voice was registering determination as she spoke about her goals.

meanings.definition: To sign up or enroll for a service or event.
meanings.sent1: They are registering for the cooking class next week.
meanings.sent2: I will be registering for the marathon to support a good cause.
meanings.sent3: The cat was registering for the catnip tasting event at the local pet store.
meanings.sent4: The birds were registering for the early morning singing competition.
meanings.sent5: He was registering for the charity run to raise funds for the homeless shelter.
